                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->r<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->reply to current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Ctrl+Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->⌘+Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->save issue reply (submit issue on issue filing page)<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Anywhere<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->/<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->focus on the issue search field<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->c<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->compose a new issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->s<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->star the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->show this help dialog<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
        </div>
        
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        <p>
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        </p>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>I originally reported this as <span class="line"><!---->I originally reported this as <!----></span>issue 1184628<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1184628" title="Crash in WindowTreeHostPlatform::OnBoundsChanged with libstdc++"><!---->issue 1184628<!----></a>, <span class="line"><!---->, <!----></span>after observing several crashes of my custom-built Chromium (linked to system libstdc++). The crash occurs while dragging a tab around, detaching and reattaching repeatedly. The `--start-maximized` flag makes it quite easy to reproduce. Further investigation with an ASan-enabled build reveals a use-after-free bug in WindowTreeHostPlatform::OnBoundsChanged.<span class="line"><!---->after observing several crashes of my custom-built Chromium (linked to system libstdc++). The crash occurs while dragging a tab around, detaching and reattaching repeatedly. The `--start-maximized` flag makes it quite easy to reproduce. Further investigation with an ASan-enabled build reveals a use-after-free bug in WindowTreeHostPlatform::OnBoundsChanged.<!----></span><br><br>The same ASan report is reproducible with libc++ (which is what Chrome uses), even though a crash isn't readily observed. This might be due to differences in how libc++ and libstdc++ handle object destruction or memory allocation. Based on the reproducibility of the ASan report with libc++, I decided to follow up my original normal issue with this security one.<span class="line"><!---->The same ASan report is reproducible with libc++ (which is what Chrome uses), even though a crash isn't readily observed. This might be due to differences in how libc++ and libstdc++ handle object destruction or memory allocation. Based on the reproducibility of the ASan report with libc++, I decided to follow up my original normal issue with this security one.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 89.0.4389.82 stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 89.0.4389.82 stable<!----></span><br>Operating System: Arch Linux (rolling) with Xfce 4.16 and display compositing disabled<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Arch Linux (rolling) with Xfce 4.16 and display compositing disabled<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1) Build Chrome with "is_asan=true is_debug=false" and start it with --start-maximized<span class="line"><!---->1) Build Chrome with "is_asan=true is_debug=false" and start it with --start-maximized<!----></span><br>2) Drag a tab around, repeatedly detaching and reattaching (as shown in the attached video)<span class="line"><!---->2) Drag a tab around, repeatedly detaching and reattaching (as shown in the attached video)<!----></span><br>3) ASan should abort with a heap-use-after-free in WindowTreeHostPlatform::OnBoundsChanged<span class="line"><!---->3) ASan should abort with a heap-use-after-free in WindowTreeHostPlatform::OnBoundsChanged<!----></span><br><br>If it proves difficult to reproduce, the ASan report might provide enough context to spot the cause.<span class="line"><!---->If it proves difficult to reproduce, the ASan report might provide enough context to spot the cause.<!----></span><br><br>Type of crash: browser<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: browser<!----></span><br>Crash State: see attached ASan report (libcxx-tab-drag-heap-use-after-free.txt)<span class="line"><!---->Crash State: see attached ASan report (libcxx-tab-drag-heap-use-after-free.txt)<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Evangelos Foutras <<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Evangelos Foutras &lt;<!----></span>evangelos@foutrelis.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/evangelos@foutrelis.com"><!---->evangelos@foutrelis.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/5e3a738b1204941aab9f15c0eb3d06e20fefd96e<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/5e3a738b1204941aab9f15c0eb3d06e20fefd96e"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/5e3a738b1204941aab9f15c0eb3d06e20fefd96e<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>5e3a738b1204941aab9f15c0eb3d06e20fefd96e<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/5e3a738b1204941aab9f15c0eb3d06e20fefd96e"><!---->5e3a738b1204941aab9f15c0eb3d06e20fefd96e<!----></a><br>Author: Scott Violet <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Scott Violet &lt;<!----></span>sky@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/sky@chromium.org"><!---->sky@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Mon Mar 08 21:07:39 2021<span class="line"><!---->Date: Mon Mar 08 21:07:39 2021<!----></span><br><br>x11/ozone: fix two edge cases<span class="line"><!---->x11/ozone: fix two edge cases<!----></span><br><br>WindowTreeHost::OnHostMovedInPixels() may trigger a nested message<span class="line"><!---->WindowTreeHost::OnHostMovedInPixels() may trigger a nested message<!----></span><br>loop (tab dragging), which when the stack unravels means this may<span class="line"><!---->loop (tab dragging), which when the stack unravels means this may<!----></span><br>be deleted. This adds an early out if this happens.<span class="line"><!---->be deleted. This adds an early out if this happens.<!----></span><br><br>X11WholeScreenMoveLoop has a similar issue, in so far as notifying<span class="line"><!---->X11WholeScreenMoveLoop has a similar issue, in so far as notifying<!----></span><br>the delegate may delete this.<span class="line"><!---->the delegate may delete this.<!----></span><br><br>BUG=1185482<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1185482" title="Security: use-after-free in WindowTreeHostPlatform::OnBoundsChanged"><!---->BUG=1185482<!----></a><br>TEST=WindowTreeHostPlatform.DeleteHostFromOnHostMovedInPixels<span class="line"><!---->TEST=WindowTreeHostPlatform.DeleteHostFromOnHostMovedInPixels<!----></span><br><br>Change-Id: Ieca1c90b3e4358da50b332abe2941fdbb50c5c25<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id:         Thanks for the fix! For what is worth, I briefly mentioned in <span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the fix! For what is worth, I briefly mentioned in <!----></span>issue 1184628<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1184628" title="Crash in WindowTreeHostPlatform::OnBoundsChanged with libstdc++"><!---->issue 1184628<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>(<span class="line"><!---->(<!----></span>comment 1<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c1"><!---->comment 1<!----></a>) that the crash occurs during regular use too. It's very infrequent though, possibly requiring `--start-maximized` and/or Chromium built against libstdc++ to manifest. While the ASan report shows it's reproducible with libc++ too, if you haven't seen any crash reports about this then Chrome is probably safe. :)<span class="line"><!---->) that the crash occurs during regular use too. It's very infrequent though, possibly requiring `--start-maximized` and/or Chromium built against libstdc++ to manifest. While the ASan report shows it's reproducible with libc++ too, if you haven't seen any crash reports about this then Chrome is probably safe. :)<!----></span><br><br>Also confirming that the fix appears to work for my custom Chromium 89 build; it no longer crashes when moving tabs around.<span class="line"><!---->Also confirming that the fix appears to work for my custom Chromium 89 build; it no longer crashes when moving tabs around.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I wish to amend my previous statement that "Chrome is probably safe"; I was thinking in terms of crashing, but the use-after-free can very well exist in Chrome too (based on the ASan report with libc++). I don't feel that a use-after-free could be considered safe just because it's not visibly affecting Chrome (and Chromium linked against libc++), when libstdc++ builds infrequently crash during regular use (with the same backtrace).<span class="line"><!---->I wish to amend my previous statement that "Chrome is probably safe"; I was thinking in terms of crashing, but the use-after-free can very well exist in Chrome too (based on the ASan report with libc++). I don't feel that a use-after-free could be considered safe just because it's not visibly affecting Chrome (and Chromium linked against libc++), when libstdc++ builds infrequently crash during regular use (with the same backtrace).<!----></span><br><br>Anyway, I just wanted to correct my previous comment. I'm sure you can assess the severity and impact of the bug much better than me.<span class="line"><!---->Anyway, I just wanted to correct my previous comment. I'm sure you can assess the severity and impact of the bug much better than me.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Your change meets the bar and is auto-approved for M90. Please go ahead and merge the CL to branch 4430 (refs/branch-heads/4430) manually. Please contact milestone owner if you have questions.<span class="line"><!---->Your change meets the bar and is auto-approved for M90.         sky@ we normally merge high severity security bug fixes back to stable, because we have adversaries who weaponize our git commits in a small number of days. UaFs in the browser process are critical severity but this is mitigated to High by virtue of the fact it requires user action. In practice I think the level of user interaction is pretty darned high, so I'm not hugely vocal about the need to ship this in an M89 refresh, but that would be our normal practice. Do you have specific stability concerns about this fix? Re-adding Merge-Request-89 for consideration.<span class="line"><!---->sky@ we normally merge high severity security bug fixes back to stable, because we have adversaries who weaponize our git commits in a small number of days. UaFs in the browser process are critical severity but this is mitigated to High by virtue of the fact it requires user action. In practice I think the level of user interaction is pretty darned high, so I'm not hugely vocal about the need to ship this in an M89 refresh, but that would be our normal practice. Do you have specific stability concerns about this fix? Re-adding Merge-Request-89 for consideration.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);

  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }

                focus on the issue search field<span class="key-tip"><!---->focus on the issue search field<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    c<kbd><!---->c<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->c<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                compose a new issue<span class="key-tip"><!---->compose a new issue<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    s<kbd><!---->s<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->s<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                star the current issue<span class="key-tip"><!---->star the current issue<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    ?<kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>

                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                show this help dialog<span class="key-tip"><!---->show this help dialog<!----></span>

          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

        Description #1 by evang...@foutrelis.com (Mar 6, 2021)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by evang...@foutrelis.com (Mar 6, 2021)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>I originally reported this as <span class="line"><!---->I originally reported this as <!----></span>issue 1184628<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1184628" title="Crash in WindowTreeHostPlatform::OnBoundsChanged with libstdc++"><!---->issue 1184628<!----></a>, <span class="line"><!---->, <!----></span>after observing several crashes of my custom-built Chromium (linked to system libstdc++). The crash occurs while dragging a tab around, detaching and reattaching repeatedly. The `--start-maximized` flag makes it quite easy to reproduce. Further investigation with an ASan-enabled build reveals a use-after-free bug in WindowTreeHostPlatform::OnBoundsChanged.<span class="line"><!---->after observing several crashes of my custom-built Chromium (linked to system libstdc++). The crash occurs while dragging a tab around, detaching and reattaching repeatedly. The `--start-maximized` flag makes it quite easy to reproduce. Further investigation with an ASan-enabled build reveals a use-after-free bug in WindowTreeHostPlatform::OnBoundsChanged.<!----></span><br><br>The same ASan report is reproducible with libc++ (which is what Chrome uses), even though a crash isn't readily observed. This might be due to differences in how libc++ and libstdc++ handle object destruction or memory allocation. Based on the reproducibility of the ASan report with libc++, I decided to follow up my original normal issue with this security one.<span class="line"><!---->The same ASan report is reproducible with libc++ (which is what Chrome uses), even though a crash isn't readily observed. This might be due to differences in how libc++ and libstdc++ handle object destruction or memory allocation. Based on the reproducibility of the ASan report with libc++, I decided to follow up my original normal issue with this security one.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 89.0.4389.82 stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 89.0.4389.82 stable<!----></span><br>Operating System: Arch Linux (rolling) with Xfce 4.16 and display compositing disabled<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Arch Linux (rolling) with Xfce 4.16 and display compositing disabled<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1) Build Chrome with "is_asan=true is_debug=false" and start it with --start-maximized<span class="line"><!---->1) Build Chrome with "is_asan=true is_debug=false" and start it with --start-maximized<!----></span><br>2) Drag a tab around, repeatedly detaching and reattaching (as shown in the attached video)<span class="line"><!---->2) Drag a tab around, repeatedly detaching and reattaching (as shown in the attached video)<!----></span><br>3) ASan should abort with a heap-use-after-free in WindowTreeHostPlatform::OnBoundsChanged<span class="line"><!---->3) ASan should abort with a heap-use-after-free in WindowTreeHostPlatform::OnBoundsChanged<!----></span><br><br>If it proves difficult to reproduce, the ASan report might provide enough context to spot the cause.<span class="line"><!---->If it proves difficult to reproduce, the ASan report might provide enough context to spot the cause.<!----></span><br><br>Type of crash: browser<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: browser<!----></span><br>Crash State: see attached ASan report (libcxx-tab-drag-heap-use-after-free.txt)<span class="line"><!---->Crash State: see attached ASan report (libcxx-tab-drag-heap-use-after-free.txt)<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Evangelos Foutras <<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Evangelos Foutras &lt;<!----></span>evangelos@foutrelis.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/evangelos@foutrelis.com"><!---->evangelos@foutrelis.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Thanks for the fix! For what is worth, I briefly mentioned in <span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the fix! It's very infrequent though, possibly requiring `--start-maximized` and/or Chromium built against libstdc++ to manifest. While the ASan report shows it's reproducible with libc++ too, if you haven't seen any crash reports about this then Chrome is probably safe. :)<span class="line"><!---->) that the crash occurs during regular use too.         I wish to amend my previous statement that "Chrome is probably safe"; I was thinking in terms of crashing, but the use-after-free can very well exist in Chrome too (based on the ASan report with libc++). I don't feel that a use-after-free could be considered safe just because it's not visibly affecting Chrome (and Chromium linked against libc++), when libstdc++ builds infrequently crash during regular use (with the same backtrace).<span class="line"><!---->I wish to amend my previous statement that "Chrome is probably safe"; I was thinking in terms of crashing, but the use-after-free can very well exist in Chrome too (based on the ASan report with libc++). I don't feel that a use-after-free could be considered safe just because it's not visibly affecting Chrome (and Chromium linked against libc++), when libstdc++ builds infrequently crash during regular use (with the same backtrace).<!----></span><br><br>Anyway, I just wanted to correct my previous comment. I'm sure you can assess the severity and impact of the bug much better than me.<span class="line"><!---->Anyway, I just wanted to correct my previous comment. I'm sure you can assess the severity and impact of the bug much better than me.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        sky@ we normally merge high severity security bug fixes back to stable, because we have adversaries who weaponize our git commits in a small number of days. UaFs in the browser process are critical severity but this is mitigated to High by virtue of the fact it requires user action. In practice I think the level of user interaction is pretty darned high, so I'm not hugely vocal about the need to ship this in an M89 refresh, but that would be our normal practice. Do you have specific stability concerns about this fix? Re-adding Merge-Request-89 for consideration.<span class="line"><!---->sky@ we normally merge high severity security bug fixes back to stable, because we have adversaries who weaponize our git commits in a small number of days. UaFs in the browser process are critical severity but this is mitigated to High by virtue of the fact it requires user action. In practice I think the level of user interaction is pretty darned high, so I'm not hugely vocal about the need to ship this in an M89 refresh, but that would be our normal practice. Do you have specific stability concerns about this fix? Re-adding Merge-Request-89 for consideration.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This bug requires manual review: Request affecting a post-stable build<span class="line"><!---->This bug requires manual review: Request affecting a post-stable build<!----></span><br>Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<!----></span><br><br>1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<span class="line"><!---->2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<!----></span><br>3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<!----></span><br>5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<span class="line"><!---->5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<!----></span><br>6. Is this a new feature?<span class="line"><!---->6. Is this a new feature?<!----></span><br>7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<span class="line"><!---->7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<!----></span><br><br>Chrome OS Only:<span class="line"><!---->Chrome OS Only:<!----></span><br>8. Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? See Eng Prod ownership by component: <span class="line"><!---->8.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          align-items: stretch;

        mr-launch-overview[hidden] {
          display: none;
        }
        mr-phase {
          margin-bottom: 0.75em;
        }
      </style>
      
      
    <!----></mr-launch-overview>
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {

        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;

          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }

          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;

          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;

            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {

            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;

            border: 0;

            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>I originally reported this as <span class="line"><!---->I originally reported this as <!----></span>issue 1184628<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1184628" title="Crash in WindowTreeHostPlatform::OnBoundsChanged with libstdc++"><!---->issue 1184628<!----></a>, <span class="line"><!---->, <!----></span>after observing several crashes of my custom-built Chromium (linked to system libstdc++). The crash occurs while dragging a tab around, detaching and reattaching repeatedly. The `--start-maximized` flag makes it quite easy to reproduce. Further investigation with an ASan-enabled build reveals a use-after-free bug in WindowTreeHostPlatform::OnBoundsChanged.<span class="line"><!---->after observing several crashes of my custom-built Chromium (linked to system libstdc++). The crash occurs while dragging a tab around, detaching and reattaching repeatedly. The `--start-maximized` flag makes it quite easy to reproduce. Further investigation with an ASan-enabled build reveals a use-after-free bug in WindowTreeHostPlatform::OnBoundsChanged.<!----></span><br><br>The same ASan report is reproducible with libc++ (which is what Chrome uses), even though a crash isn't readily observed. This might be due to differences in how libc++ and libstdc++ handle object destruction or memory allocation. Based on the reproducibility of the ASan report with libc++, I decided to follow up my original normal issue with this security one.<span class="line"><!---->The same ASan report is reproducible with libc++ (which is what Chrome uses), even though a crash isn't readily observed. This might be due to differences in how libc++ and libstdc++ handle object destruction or memory allocation. Based on the reproducibility of the ASan report with libc++, I decided to follow up my original normal issue with this security one.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 89.0.4389.82 stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 89.0.4389.82 stable<!----></span><br>Operating System: Arch Linux (rolling) with Xfce 4.16 and display compositing disabled<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Arch Linux (rolling) with Xfce 4.16 and display compositing disabled<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1) Build Chrome with "is_asan=true is_debug=false" and start it with --start-maximized<span class="line"><!---->1) Build Chrome with "is_asan=true is_debug=false" and start it with --start-maximized<!----></span><br>2) Drag a tab around, repeatedly detaching and reattaching (as shown in the attached video)<span class="line"><!---->2) Drag a tab around, repeatedly detaching and reattaching (as shown in the attached video)<!----></span><br>3) ASan should abort with a heap-use-after-free in WindowTreeHostPlatform::OnBoundsChanged<span class="line"><!---->3) ASan should abort with a heap-use-after-free in WindowTreeHostPlatform::OnBoundsChanged<!----></span><br><br>If it proves difficult to reproduce, the ASan report might provide enough context to spot the cause.<span class="line"><!---->If it proves difficult to reproduce, the ASan report might provide enough context to spot the cause.<!----></span><br><br>Type of crash: browser<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: browser<!----></span><br>Crash State: see attached ASan report (libcxx-tab-drag-heap-use-after-free.txt)<span class="line"><!---->Crash State: see attached ASan report (libcxx-tab-drag-heap-use-after-free.txt)<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Evangelos Foutras <<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Evangelos Foutras &lt;<!----></span>evangelos@foutrelis.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/evangelos@foutrelis.com"><!---->evangelos@foutrelis.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

        Thanks for the fix! For what is worth, I briefly mentioned in <span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the fix! It's very infrequent though, possibly requiring `--start-maximized` and/or Chromium built against libstdc++ to manifest. While the ASan report shows it's reproducible with libc++ too, if you haven't seen any crash reports about this then Chrome is probably safe. :)<span class="line"><!---->) that the crash occurs during regular use too.         I wish to amend my previous statement that "Chrome is probably safe"; I was thinking in terms of crashing, but the use-after-free can very well exist in Chrome too (based on the ASan report with libc++). I don't feel that a use-after-free could be considered safe just because it's not visibly affecting Chrome (and Chromium linked against libc++), when libstdc++ builds infrequently crash during regular use (with the same backtrace).<span class="line"><!---->I wish to amend my previous statement that "Chrome is probably safe"; I was thinking in terms of crashing, but the use-after-free can very well exist in Chrome too (based on the ASan report with libc++). I don't feel that a use-after-free could be considered safe just because it's not visibly affecting Chrome (and Chromium linked against libc++), when libstdc++ builds infrequently crash during regular use (with the same backtrace).<!----></span><br><br>Anyway, I just wanted to correct my previous comment. I'm sure you can assess the severity and impact of the bug much better than me.<span class="line"><!---->Anyway, I just wanted to correct my previous comment. This adds an early out if this happens.<span class="line"><!---->be deleted. This adds an early out if this happens.<!----></span><br><br>X11WholeScreenMoveLoop has a similar issue, in so far as notifying<span class="line"><!---->X11WholeScreenMoveLoop has a similar issue, in so far as notifying<!----></span><br>the delegate may delete this.<span class="line"><!---->the delegate may delete this.<!----></span><br><br>BUG=1185482<a class="strike-through" target="_blank"         sky@ we normally merge high severity security bug fixes back to stable, because we have adversaries who weaponize our git commits in a small number of days. UaFs in the browser process are critical severity but this is mitigated to High by virtue of the fact it requires user action. In practice I think the level of user interaction is pretty darned high, so I'm not hugely vocal about the need to ship this in an M89 refresh, but that would be our normal practice. Do you have specific stability concerns about this fix? Re-adding Merge-Request-89 for consideration.<span class="line"><!---->sky@ we normally merge high severity security bug fixes back to stable, because we have adversaries who weaponize our git commits in a small number of days. UaFs in the browser process are critical severity but this is mitigated to High by virtue of the fact it requires user action. In practice I think the level of user interaction is pretty darned high, so I'm not hugely vocal about the need to ship this in an M89 refresh, but that would be our normal practice. Do you have specific stability concerns about this fix? Re-adding Merge-Request-89 for consideration.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>
